channel.title: typedef :: CIS 308 Textbook
channel.description: It gets a bit cumbersome to use types called struct person and enum grade. It would be much nicer to be able to call them just person or grade. With Câ€™s typedef construct, we can do just that. The format of typedef is: typedef oldType newType;Here, we rename type oldType to the new name newType. We can now create variables using the name newType. For example: typedef char letterGrade; letterGrade g; g = 'A';Notice that we treat our new letterGrade type just like it was a char.
